articles.title: Early Signs and Symptoms of Pregnancy

content.headline: Recognizing the Early Signs of Pregnancy
content.intro: Pregnancy brings various physical and emotional changes that can begin even before a missed period. Understanding these early signs can help you recognize pregnancy and take appropriate next steps. Every woman's experience is unique, and symptoms can vary widely in timing and intensity.

sections.title: Common Early Pregnancy Signs
sections.content: These symptoms often appear in the first few weeks of pregnancy:
points: Missed period - often the first noticeable sign
Tender, swollen breasts - due to hormonal changes
Nausea with or without vomiting - can occur any time of day
Increased urination - as early as 2-3 weeks after conception
Fatigue and exhaustion - caused by rising progesterone levels
Food cravings or aversions - sudden dislike of certain foods
Mild cramping and spotting - implantation bleeding may occur
Mood swings - emotional changes due to hormonal fluctuations
Bloating and constipation - digestive system slows down
Nasal congestion - increased blood flow to mucous membranes

sections.title: Timeline of Early Symptoms
sections.content: Symptoms typically appear in this general sequence:
points: Week 1-4: Missed period, fatigue, breast tenderness
Week 4-6: Nausea, food aversions, increased urination
Week 6-8: Mood swings, bloating, mild cramping
Week 8+: Visible physical changes may begin

sections.title: When to Take a Pregnancy Test
points: Wait until after your missed period for most accurate results
Use first-morning urine when hCG concentration is highest
Follow test instructions carefully for proper timing
Confirm positive results with healthcare provider
Consider blood tests for earliest detection (7-12 days after conception)
